server.name: Apache
server.desc: The Apache HTTP Server Project is an effort to develop and maintain an open-source HTTP server.

server.name: Apache Tomcat Coyote
server.desc: Coyote is Tomcat's HTTP Connector component that supports the HTTP 1.1 protocol for the web server or application container.

server.name: lighttpd
server.desc: Lightweight open-source web server.

server.name: Nginx
server.desc: Nginx is a free, open-source, high-performance HTTP server.

server.name: Google Web Server
server.desc: Custom Linux-based Web server that Google uses for its online services.

server.name: Microsoft IIS
server.desc: Internet Information Services is a flexible, secure and easy-to-manage Web server for hosting anything on the Web.

server.name: Unix
server.desc: Unix is a multitasking, multi-user computer operating system.

server.name: Linux
server.desc: Unix-like computer operating system assembled under the model of free and open source software development and distribution.

server.name: Ubuntu
server.desc: Commercially sponsored Debian-derived Linux distribution that focuses on usability.

server.name: Rack Cache
server.desc: Rack::Cache is suitable as a quick drop-in component to enable HTTP caching for Rack-based applications.

server.name: Varnish
server.desc: Varnish is a web application accelerator.

server.name: Apache Traffic Server
server.desc: Apache Traffic Server(tm) software is a fast, scalable and extensible HTTP/1.1 compliant caching proxy server.

server.name: LiteSpeed
server.desc: LiteSpeed - the ultimate solution for your web infrastructure.

server.name: Fedora
server.desc: A Linux based operating system.

server.name: CentOS
server.desc: CentOS is an Enterprise-class Linux Distribution derived from sources freely provided to the public by a prominent North American Enterprise Linux vendor.

server.name: Debian
server.desc: Debian is an operating system and a distribution of Free Software.

server.name: PHP
server.desc: PHP is a widely-used general-purpose scripting language that is especially suited for Web development.

server.name: Perl
server.desc: Perl is a high-level, general-purpose, interpreted, dynamic programming language.

server.name: Python
server.desc: Python is an interpreted, interactive, object-oriented, extensible programming language.

server.name: ASP.NET
server.desc: ASP.NET is a free web framework for building great Web sites and Web applications.

server.name: J2EE
server.desc: The Java 2 Platform, Enterprise Edition (J2EE) defines the standard for developing multitier enterprise applications.

server.name: OpenSSL
server.desc: A toolkit implementing SSL v2/v3 and TLS protocols with full-strength cryptography world-wide.

server.name: FrontPage Extension
server.desc: A software technology that allows Microsoft FrontPage clients to communicate with web servers.

server.name: mod_ssl
server.desc: This module provides strong cryptography for the Apache webserver.

server.name: WebDAV
server.desc: Web Distributed Authoring and Versioning (WebDAV) is an extension of the Hypertext Transfer Protocol.

server.name: P3P Policy
server.desc: Platform for Privacy Preferences Project (P3P) is a protocol allowing websites to declare their intended use of information they collect about web browser users.

server.name: Google App Engine
server.desc: Offers users the ability to build and host web applications on Google's infrastructure.

server.name: Zend Server
server.desc: Leverage the power of Zend Server to run your Business-Critical PHP applications.

server.name: Lotus Domino
server.desc: An IBM server product that provides enterprise-grade e-mail, collaboration capabilities, and a custom application platform.

server.name: AOLserver
server.desc: AOLserver is America Online's open source web server.

server.name: Phusion Passenger
server.desc: a.k.a. mod_rails or mod_rack - makes deployment of Ruby web applications, such as Ruby on Rails, a breeze.

server.name: CloudFlare
server.desc: Offers free and commercial, cloud-based services to help secure and accelerate websites.

server.name: ColdFusion
server.desc: The Adobe ColdFusion application server enables the rapid development, deployment, and maintainance of rich and robust Internet applications.
